title: (x) Helvetica look alike for 'Barbican' book cover - Rail Alphabet {Andrew}
author: NPS

comments.content:
Could it be New Rail Alphabet by Margaret Calvert/Henrik Kubel?  
Do you know who designed the book?
(Edited) No I don't think it is.

Not Helvetica. The "n" curve is too uncompensated, the "a" bowl too straight at the top, the middle of the "s" too horizontal.

Edit: This was a reply to a now edited speculation that the sample may be Helvetica.
Is this another attempt from you for [Unica Haas](http://web.archive.org/web/20101014183138/http:/typophile.com/node/51338)?

No attempt for Unica Haas ...  
i know itâ€™s not Helvetica ... I guess 1985 is prob right, just had a look at the site.  
It was designed by Cartlidge Levene ..

Thanks for help!

It's not Haas Unica either, the a in that alphabet is much curvier. It reminds me most of old British Rail signage and little known 'Airport' typeface (pretty much the same thing, I think).

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rail\_Alphabet](http://web.archive.org/web/20101014183138/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rail_Alphabet "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rail\_Alphabet")

The s is the giveaway character.

[http://www.newrailalphabet.co.uk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20101014183138/http:/www.newrailalphabet.co.uk/ "http://www.newrailalphabet.co.uk/")

Here is some more information on the digital version, which I think differs quite a bit, though it is in a sense official as it was revised by it's author.
I hope Barbican is Gold Foil.
Do I get my gold star now?
Yes, you can. Sorry for the delayed award ceremony!
